sen.e: Ryonin (February 10, 1073 ? - February 19, 1132) was a Buddhist monk of Tendai Sect who was active in the late Heian Period and the founder of Yuzu Nenbutsu Sect.

sen.j: 22歳から23歳のころ京都大原に隠棲して念仏三昧の一方で、来迎院 (京都市左京区)・浄蓮華院を創建し（寂光院も良忍による創建説がある）、また分裂していた天台声明の統一をはかり、大原声明を完成させた。
sen.e: When he was 22 or 23 years old, he entered a secluded life at Kyoto Ohara and devoted to praying to Buddha but in the meantime, he founded Raigo-in Temple (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City) and Jorenge-in Temple (some assert that Jakko-in Temple was also founded by Ryonin) and completed Ohara Shomyo by unifying divided Tendai Shomyo.

sen.j: 1117年（永久 (元号)5年）阿弥陀仏の示現を受け、「1人の念仏が万人の念仏に通じる」という自他の念仏が相即融合しあうという立場から融通念仏を創始し、称名念仏で浄土に生まれると説き、結縁した人々の名を記入する名帳を携えて各地で勧進を行った。
sen.e: In 1117, he received the manifestation of Amida-Buddha and created Yuzu-Nenbutsu based on the thought that Nenbutsu recited by oneself and others can be united each other or "Nenbutsu recited by a person can be nenbutsu for everybody", and thereafter he advocated rebirth in Jodo (pure land) by means of Chengming nianfo and made propagation at various places with carrying meicho(name list)that was to be used for recording the name of people who made connection with Buddha.

In 1117, he received the manifestation of Amida-Buddha and created Yuzu-Nenbutsu based on the thought that Nenbutsu recited by oneself and others can be united with each other or "Nenbutsu recited by a person can be nenbutsu for everybody", and thereafter he advocated rebirth in Jodo (pure land) by means of Chengming nianfo and made propagation at various places while carrying a meicho(name list)that was to be used for recording the names of people who made a connection with Buddha.

In 1117, he received the manifestation of Amida-Buddha and created Yuzu Nenbutsu based on the thought that Nenbutsu recited by oneself and others can be united with each other or 'Nenbutsu recited by a person can be nenbutsu for everybody,' and thereafter he advocated rebirth in Jodo (pure land) by means of Shomyo Nenbutsu (Invocation of the Buddha's Name) and made propagation at various places while carrying a meicho (name list) that was to be used for recording the names of people who made a connection with Buddha.

sen.j: 四天王寺に参籠した時に見た霊夢により、摂津国住吉郡平野庄（現大阪市平野区）の領主の坂上広野の邸宅地に開いた修楽寺が、その後の融通念仏の総本山の大念仏寺の前身である。
sen.e: According to reimu (dream of Buddha's oracle) that Ryonin had when he confined himself in Shitenno-ji Temple, he founded Shuraku-ji Temple at the residence of SAKANOUE no Hirono, then the feudal lord of Settsu-no-Kuni Sumiyoshi-gun Hirano-sho (Hirano Ward, Osaka City), and it was the predecessor of Dainenbutsu-ji Temple, the head temple of Yuzu Nenbutsu Sect.
